We need to work together to ensure that we can control the spread so we do not endanger our unique communities in Florida especially given our high proportion of elderly and medically vulnerable populations.  @GovRonDeSantis let's get this done and take care of our community.

Schedule more regular calls for Members of Florida’s congressional delegation with key agencies and establish clear lines of communications with health departments.  There's been major communication gaps during this crisis. We need transparency.

Work with the state legislature to expand Medicaid coverage under the Affordable Care Act.  This should have been done years ago but now it is needed more than ever. Our community MUST know that they have health coverage during this global pandemic.

Raise unemployment benefits and expand eligibility for small businesses to apply for @SBAgov loans.  Our workers and small businesses are the backbone of our economy and they are hurting. We must take steps to ensure they can weather this crisis.

Close any public areas that have a high potential for crowds such as public beaches and recreational facilities.  This weekend we saw huge crowds at beaches no doubt spreading the disease among each other.  We must all make sacrifices to keep our community safe.

-Large corporations receiving significant federal stimulus funding must ensure they provide paid sick leave family leave health care benefits retirement moving forward  -Large corporations must keep their employees on payroll to be eligible for financial stimulus funding

-Reduce small business loan rate or eliminate altogether for loans taken out during emergency  -Increase federal reimbursements for cleaning/sanitizing costs   -Any emergency stimulus funding to large corporations cannot be used for stock buy-backs or golden parachutes

-Provide funding for 501(c)(3)s so nonprofit organizations can continue their important work during this pandemic  -Remove the carveout for businesses over 500 which exempts them from being required to provide paid sick leave

-Expand small business loan eligibility to small businesses that already have existing lines of credit  -Defer loan payments on small business loans  -Utilize unused hotels & cruise ships as quarantine locations

-Increase funding for mobile health clinics community health clinics non-profits that deliver primary care  -Extend open enrollment period for ACA  -Provide coverage for testing screening and treatment for #COVID19

-Monthly payment of at least $1K to each adult (no b/millionaires)  -Expanded paid sick leave  -Expanded housing subsidies to assist low-income families with rent payments  -Expand Sec. 8 housing vouchers  -Halt evictions  -Halt student loan payments & defer interest

-Reinstate protections for the health care workforce that were originally in the first #COVID19 response package  -Create a rapid certification program to have foreign-educated physicians residing in the US working in a non-medical field assist with some health care functions
